result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Return date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.

2:24 PM Defendant MICHAEL A CONNOR in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson in court for MICHAEL A CONNOR.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelson has not received a copy of the information.  Court goes over maximum penalties. Atty Nelson acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 2:26 PM

Court will set for Return Date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 AM.

records.addlTxt: The defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without Court approval. The defendant shall forfeit any passport in his possession. The defendant shall have No Contact with the victim, the victim's family, or the victim's residence. The defendant shall have No Contact with any minor. No Contact is defined as: no contact in person, in writing, electronically, or through a third party other than an attorney. The defendant shall not possess any device capable of connecting to the internet. GPS Monitoring.

3:24 PM Defendant MICHAEL A CONNOR in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for MICHAEL A CONNOR.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes bond was going to be addressed at this hearing and Atty Nelson was just appointed yesterday. Atty Nelson states the defendant would like to waive the right to a preliminary hearing. Statement by DA Laspisa - questions whether the defendant is eligible for the public defender. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. Court sets Arraignment for October 31, 2022 at 2:30 PM. 

Court notes he previously stated bond would be addressed at this hearing. Statement by DA Laspisa regarding bond. Court asks DA for more information on a bank account the defendant has access to. Further statement by DA Laspisa. Statement by Atty Nelson regarding bond. Argument by DA Laspisa. Court orders bond to be amended to $2,000,000 all other conditions to remain the same. Court will readdress bond at the arraignment hearing.

Court adjourned at 3:50 PM.
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Atty Scott Nelson

4:19 PM Defendant MICHAEL A CONNOR in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Nelson present in court with defendant Michael Connor. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Nelson, he will be making a courtesy appearance today and states that they are still attempting to see if the defendant qualifies and the defendant will waive the time limits on the preliminary hearing. Argument by DA Laspisa regarding bond modification, requests the Court increase the amount. Argument by Atty Nelson, requests a lower cash bond. Statement by the Court - amends the bond to $5,000,000 and adds GPS monitoring. Court will set for Status of Counsel on September 21, 2022 at 2:30 PM

Court adjourned at 4:43 PM

Decision by the Court regarding the Motion for Reconsideration of Denial of Release from Custody filed by Atty Scott Nelson
Initial Appearance and Bond/Motion hearing held on August 22, 2022, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Karen Blair - Court Reporter
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.           (per Judge)
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Reconsider the Motion for Denial of Release from Custody Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 969.035

ADDRESS INFO for MICHAEL A CONNOR
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 08-22-2022)
Prior: 1347 Felicita Ln, Escondido, CA 92029
for Denial of Release From Custody Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 969.035
Requesting No Contact While In Custody Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 940.07

1:23 PM Defendant MICHAEL A CONNOR appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Scott Nelson appeared by zoom for MICHAEL A CONNOR. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and asks the defendant if he'd like the complaint read to him. Defendant waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA Laspisa states she is filing a motion for denial of release from custody pursuant to statute 969.035 and a motion requesting No Contact with the victim while he is in custody pursuant to statute 940.47. DA Laspisa states she is emailing a copy of the motions to Atty Nelson and hands paper copy to the Court. Further statement by DA Laspisa. DA Laspisa requests that release for the defendant be denied by the Court. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Atty Nelson makes bond recommendation. Atty Nelson objects to the motion being filed after the case was called and objects that the 969.035 statute is necessary for this circumstance. Court denies pretrial release. Court sets hearing August 29, 2022 at 3:15 PM. Statement by the Court - no bond will be ordered and release is denied. Court will tentatively agree to have No Contact under 940.47, but will address that at the August 29 hearing.  Statement by DA Laspisa. Court instructs defendant on attorney rights. 

Court adjourned at 1:47 PM.

After court, the Court changed the time for the Hearing on August 29, 2022 from 3:15 PM to 2:30 PM.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
